misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of MD5 as a cryptographic hash function is insecure and should not be used for cryptographic purposes due to its weakness and vulnerability to collisions. It is recommended to use a more secure hash function such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
recommendation: Replace the use of MD5 with a more secure hash function such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
